metadata.title: CVE-2023-40547 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: [avoid incorrectly trusting HTTP headersWhen retrieving files via HTTP or related protocols, shim attempts toallocate a buffer to store the received data.  Unfortunately, this meansgetting the size from an HTTP header, which can be manipulated tospecify a size that's smaller than the received data.  In this case, thecode accidentally uses the header for the allocation but the protocolmetadata to copy it from the rx buffer, resulting in an out-of-boundswrite.This patch adds an additional check to test that the rx buffer is notlarger than the allocation.]

criterions.comment: secureboot-db package in esm-infra/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
shim-signed: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'install media keys will never be revoked').
shim: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'install media keys will never be revoked').
